s.text: "TRB" calls the ban on land mines the "politics of sentiment" and advocates clearing old mines from now-peaceful countries instead of prohibiting them from war zones like the DMZ in Korea.
Scientists want to determine the cause of the flu's potency (it killed more Americans than World Wars I and II, Korea, and Vietnam combined) and prevent future epidemics.
A story says clues to the 1918 Spanish flu epidemic may lie in the cells of seven corpses preserved by permafrost on a Norwegian island.
Newsweek says Di's death improves Prince Charles' image, transforming him from unfaithful husband to grieving father.

An article says that the Air Force is losing confidence: After the Gulf War the Air Force felt it was the most important of the four services, but cuts in funding and troop strength, as well as a move toward unmanned aircraft, have shaken it.
